column2: officially the Municipality of Mamburao (Tagalog: Bayan ng Mamburao)
column3: is a 2nd class municipality and capital of the province of Occidental Mindoro

column1: Mamburao was originally settled by the Moro people and was one of their strongholds in the island of Mindoro. The settlement was the first one in Mindoro to be plundered by the Spaniards. Hearing that it was a rich town
column2: the Spanish and their Pintado allies attacked and captured the population. The wealthy among their captives were then allowed to ransom themselves free. With their superior weapons and knowledge of war strategies used in their just concluded Reconquista
column3: they utilised this method all around the islands
column4: and by this the Spanish earned their gold.
Miguel López de Legazpi sent a fleet of 15 boats from Panay
column5: led by his grandson Juan de Salcedo
column6: to conquer the Moro town. Another expedition was sent to Mamburao
column7: led by Salcedo and Martin de Goiti
column8: with the intent of establishing Spanish presence in Mindoro.Catholicism was propagated in Mamburao and the town was placed under the third convent district based in Cavite. Mamburao was subjected to attack by the Mindanao Moro
column9: guided by its former Mamburao inhabitants who wanted to claim their lands and have a prosperous life there between the 17th and 18th centuries. Mamburao
column11: was even made into a sea haven by the Moros
column12: who used it as base of their sea attacks against Friar induced settlements on coastal towns in Mindoro

column2: encouraged by Spanish authorities promising them rich lands to till
column3: with weapons but in exchange for working as its ready foot soldiers on quick notice
column4: Mamburao then saw an influx of Ilocano and Tagalog immigrants.Near the end of the Spanish colonial period in the Philippines
column5: the settlement of Sablayan was incorporated to Mamburao as a barrio. In 1905
column6: Paluan and Abra de Ilog were likewise incorporated under Act 1280. Abra de Ilog
column7: Paluan and Sablayan were later carved out from Mamburao as separate municipalities. Another barrio of Mamburao
column9: was also made into a separate municipality
column10: in 1949.Mamburao was designated as the capital of Occidental Mindoro when the island province of Mindoro was divided into two separate provinces on June 13
column11: 1950: Oriental and Occidental Mindoro. San Jose was the temporary capital until January 1

column1: Mamburao is politically subdivided into 15 barangays. Eight barangays are found in the population created under P.D. 86 and seven are outside the poblacion area.
Tricycles are a common mode of transportation in Mamburao. Vans
column3: and buses are also available and are a means of traveling to other parts of the island of Mindoro such as the port of Abra de Ilog and the southern municipality of San Jose. Mamburao Airport serves chartered flights
column4: although Philippine Airlines used to schedule regular flights at the airport.

column1: According to the Bureau of Local Government Finance
column2: the annual regular revenue of Mamburao for the fiscal year of 2016 was ₱132
column4: 636.29.The economy of Mamburao is highly dependent on its agricultural produce. The two major crops are rice and corn. Rice production accounts to 25
column5: 527.80 MT with 4.484 MT/ha while corn production accounts to 16
column6: 273.60 MT or 7 MT/ha. This production has increased in both area and volume in the year 2016 to 2017. Exportation to Region IV-A or CALABARZON is also one of the municipality's roles.

column2: agricultural production is also varied with some farmers venturing on cassava
column7: and other products. There are also several livestock and dairy farmers particularly in Barangays Balansay
column9: and Payompon while there are also poultry farmer in Barangays Fatima

column1: Fisheries and aquaculture also play a vital role in the economy of the municipality. Among the three sectors of the fishing industry
column2: marine fishery is the most prominent with Barangays Talabaan
column8: and Tayamaan being engaged in it. Products include yellow fin tuna
column23: and lobsters are exported to Europe

column1: In terms of Mamburao's commerce and trade
column2: a concentration of commercial areas is seen in the Poblacion barangays as well as in Barangay Payompon. In 2017
column3: there was a total of 701 establishments with space rental having the highest count. General merchandise stores are also numerous in the municipality. Local revenue has also accounted to more than 1 billion coming from commerce and trade. Industry
column5: account to more than 47 million with several bagoong making establishments
column8: and others. Some of these establishments also export to neighboring municipalities as well as in CALABARZON.

column1: Vice Mayor: Joel "Big J" C. Panaligan
